website_summaries.verdict: A great CSS book for visual learners and readers needing a more hands-on approach to learning CSS.
pros: Comes with many beginning instructions and projects for new learners of CSS
Visual guide helps to break down tough concepts into more understandable chunks
cons: Not as clearly organized or focused on everyday issues and programming challenges as other resources

customer_reviews.title: Extremely complete reference designed for people already CSS practitioners.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely complete reference. Well organized. This is not a textbook to learn from (it is not organized like that). This is a reference book for someone who already knows a lot of CSS. Why pay for this book when you can just look up stuff on the web? Good question. The answer is the material is explained here in a way that provides more depth, context, and completeness than it is on the best websites I use (HTML5Doctor, MDN, W3C, and W3Schools.) And while sites like CSS Tricks are great, they only work if the question you have has been covered by them. This book covers everything CSS.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Mittleman

customer_reviews.title: Meyer Knocks It Out Of The Park, Again
customer_reviews.text: This should be on any Web developer's bookshelf. Eric had a difficult time birthing this book and thankfully got help from Estelle Weyl to get it done on time. It covers the latest CSS spec completely. If you don't need a full overview of CSS, consider getting his various themed books on positioning, layout, floating, etc. But this is the most recent version of the granddaddy of all CSS tomes, and you really can't go wrong, here.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Hiatt

customer_reviews.title: Worth the wait
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it's worth the wait. With this book sitting here, I don't need anything more. Very complete, hugely expanded over the previous edition. I could use a better - longer, more complete - index, and cheat-sheet tearout cards, but that isn't the writer's fault. The author is, as is well known, a good, clear, thorough, accurate, experienced writer. I use it as a reference book and it excels because of its completeness. But it's written in a plain but conversational tone so it could also be used for learning CSS. I was suffering waiting for this to come out!
customer_reviews.author: billfish

customer_reviews.title: Well written and Understandable
customer_reviews.text: This is very very well written book. The examples are understandable. The volume of information is incredible. This is easily going to be one on my short-reach book.
customer_reviews.author: Topher B

customer_reviews.title: I only find the beginning to be more comprehensive and so theoretical
customer_reviews.text: The book has a wonderful introduction but became incomprehensible as I read further especially in topics like "Positioning" which I learnt nothing. The book generally doesn't show examples using existing websites and is more theoretical. I would not recommend the book for beginers but rather for intermediate learners.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very thorough exploration of the latest CSS recommendations. The examples and accompanying code are quite helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nothing Left Out Here
customer_reviews.text: The definitive book of CSS. A complete resource book for CSS 3.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Biggers

customer_reviews.title: Great reference !
customer_reviews.text: Excellent reference material. The text was extremely detailed (perhaps overly so) in describing the nuances of the language. However, the book was also meticulous in alerting the readers to possible cross-browser compatibility issues associated with specific features and new specifications.
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm Martin Harris

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Read the pdf version and loved every bit of it. The authors do a tremendous job explaining all the nitty gritty details of css in a way that makes sense. This is a BIG BIG book, but well worth the time to read it and of course refer back to when needed.

customer_reviews.title: A must-buy for people learning CSS
customer_reviews.text: This book is a beast! In a great way. It's extremely comprehensive, eloquently explained, and well done. Highly recommended!
